title: Senior Product Manager (B2C Services Growth)
description:
Back Market is the world‚Äôs leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 700 people powering operations in 17 countries (and counting!).
Named one of the Worlds Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021 our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality accessible and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics.Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact. We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1000000‚ÄØtons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014.
Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.
About the Job:
Within the Product Department you will have the opportunity to build and grow brand new services for our customers and drive significant impact on Back Market growth in all our key markets (EU US APAC). 
Your mission?Drive the transformation in how consumers perceive refurbished technology.
To tackle the common challenges of budget constraints technical performance and convenience you will focus on building innovative B2C services like mobile plans insurance Upgrade program and bundled offers and enhance the overall value of Back Markets offerings.
Join us in setting a new industry standard building trust and creating long lasting relationships with new customers all while championing sustainability. If youre ready to make a meaningful impact and be a part of a groundbreaking journey this is the role for you. YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): üèÖ 
You will be the entry point for all stakeholders and other teams to understand the short medium and long term priorities and translate the company vision and OKRs into a product vision and roadmap.
You will be the main point of contact for our Services partnerships responsible for maintaining great relationship and getting the best value out of it. 
You will be the daily partner of the Engineering Manager. 
Thanks to your ownership you know how to adjust priorities if necessary communicate work closely with engineers to ensure our quality standards and respect our commitments.
You will be in charge of creating maintaining and delivering features in collaboration with business stakeholders designers and engineers.
You will liaise with all relevant Back Market counterparts (Marketing Finance Operationsteams designer researchers etc.) and different squads to ensure that your product fits perfectly into the Back Market experience across all our platforms (web + apps).
You will be the one communicating on the risks and impacts of your roadmap and features and you will be responsible for anticipating potential problems and dependencies. YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF YOU HAVE: ‚≠ê 
You are perfectly fluent in english
You have a strong experience (+5 years) as a PM working on customer facing products or/and subscription products. Bonus point if you have been evolving in a scale up environment.
You have strong experience working in an agile environment (Scrum Kanban etc.) and you are able to shape product discovery and delivery according to agile principles. 
You have already led transversal initiatives across your organization involving the alignment of several teams and stakeholders. Bonus point if you have been dealing with 3rd party integration in the past (like partnerships)
You are a brilliant communicator your peers define you as a facilitator. Your interpersonal skills will be crucial for that role to build strong relationships with stakeholders and top management.
You have no problem with navigating ambiguous situations and have a profound problem solver attitude using data and the user at the center of all your thoughts.
You use common sense. You have a strategic but simple vision of your product. For you the product must amplify the value of business expectations.
You have an analytical mindand even better an analytics background. Monitoring our key performance indicators / being able to define targeted increments is part of your daily life. 
Data is your secret weapon to better frame and measure the quality of our features and increments Additional Information 
WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? ‚úåüèº
- A meaningful job: you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts!
- A meaningful company: we became a mission-driven company in January 2022.
- Be part of a worldwide growing company based in Europe the USA and Asia to face great challenges : you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas!
- Work alongside passionate experts: who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career.
- Grow your career: with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1!
- Leadership Academy by Back Market:‚Äúbe a coach not a dictator‚Äù is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart.
- An attractive salary equity and a host of benefits including : Lunch voucher health insurance relocation package paid time off for activism in your community parental benefits flexible hours etc‚Ä¶
- Remote friendly company : up to 3 days of remote work per week!
- One Loving Tribe: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced open-minded and friendly environment.
- Be part of one of our Employee Resource Groups createdaround shared identities common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet.
- Several internal events: The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual).
- We‚Äôre here to SABOTAGE: It‚Äôs our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky always smart kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact.
Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race color religion sex national origin age disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.
Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a ‚ÄúSoci√©t√© √† Mission‚Äù or company with a social mission by the French government. We know we can‚Äôt tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds experiences and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow.

title: Strategic Account Manager, Northwest
description:
Hi from Pumpkin! 
Pumpkin is a pet care company on a mission to help make ‚Äòthe best pet care possible fur all‚Äô. We want to revolutionize pet healthcare by making it easier for families to provide their pets with the wellness and medical care they need throughout their lives. Launched by Zoetis (ZTS) a Fortune 500 company that‚Äôs the world‚Äôs largest animal health company Pumpkin is an early-stage startup with big dreams! As a pack we share agility guts collaboration and a relentless pursuit in creating a healthier happier world for pets and their people. 
Pumpkin is looking for a highly motivated and results-driven Strategic Account Manager to join our team. In this role you will play a pivotal role supporting our efforts in the veterinarian channel expanding our customer base and driving revenue growth. With a focus on building strong client relationships and executing effective sales strategies you will contribute to educating veterinary professionals on the value of pet insurance. If you have a track record of exceeding sales quotas and share our passion for pets this is the role for you!
This is a remote position requiring weekly territory travel of 4 dedicated field days and 1 home office day in the Portland metro area.  What Youll Do:  
Grow and maintain the assigned accounts in your territory
Nurture existing accounts through regular in-person check-ins ensuring continuous support and maintaining relationships with hospital staff
Deliver and educate hospitals on Pumpkin via in-person and virtual presentations
Utilize and become proficient in our CRM (Salesforce) to track and improve customer engagement on a daily basis
Generate leads and policies building effective and lasting relationships with veterinary hospitals and clinics
Educate vet hospitals on the value of Pumpkin insurance and benefits in engaging pet owners
Partner with our marketing and design teams to create sales collateral presentation decks etc.
Successfully communicate and drive Pumpkin‚Äôs newest services and initiatives
Develop and execute territory business plans routinely adjusting strategies and tactics to maximize performance based on market and customer information/needs
Meet and exceed quarterly sales goals within your territory
Be agile as we continue to grow and business needs change What Were Looking For:  
Bachelors degree in business marketing or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
3+ years of outside sales experience including managing field activity expectations and sales goals
Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets in a B2B or B2B2C approach
A solid understanding of the animal health industry including knowledge of various products pharmaceuticals and treatment protocols
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain influential relationships with veterinary professionals key opinion leaders and industry stakeholders.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with a persuasive and consultative approach
Technical competency in using CRM systems sales analytics tools and productivity tools (Word PowerPoint Excel etc)
Passion for pets and a genuine interest in promoting the benefits of pet insurance.
Ability to pass/obtain a Property & Casualty License within 30 days
Ability to work nights and weekends
60% Travel required Bonus Points: 
Experience with Salesforce CRM
Experience with Pet Insurance
Current P&C Producers license Benefits and Perks: 
Comprehensive contributions to medical dental and vision for colleagues and dependents.
Generous PTO and Paid Holidays
401k with company match
Pumpkin Insurance and preventative care for every pet in your family
The opportunity to join a team where every team member has the autonomy and support they need to boss their role and make empowered decisions
Pet Friendly Offices Stocked Kitchens Team Workouts Team Outings and much more! Additional Information 
The compensation for this position ranges from $60000- $80000 (annually). Compensation may vary outside the listed range based on a number of factors including but not limited to location qualifications performance skills and experience. The compensation range listed is just one component of Pumpkin‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. Total compensation packages depending on the position may also include incentive compensation discretionary bonuses and other short or long-term incentives. If hired employees will be in an ‚Äòat-will position‚Äô and Pumpkin reserves the right to modify compensation (as well as any other discretionary payment or benefit program) at any time including for reasons related to individual performance company or individual department/team performance and market factors.
Pumpkins Core Values:
Pets Come First: Put what‚Äôs best for pets at the center of everything we do
Trust the Pack: Help families make empowered pet care decisions
Jump Fences: If there‚Äôs a will there‚Äôs always a way over them
Share Toys: Be generous with our gifts and amazing things will happen
Dig New Holes: Challenge conventions to create the future of pet health care

title: Design Leader - Senior Manager / Director
description:
This is a full-time remote position for people based in Buenos Aires Argentina. MaintainX is the world leading mobile-first workflow management platform for industrial and frontline workers. We are a modern IoT enabled cloud based tool for maintenance safety and operations on equipment and facilities.¬† MaintainX powers operational excellence for 5000+ businesses including Univar Quikrete ABInBev Duracell Marriott and McDonald‚Äôs. Weve raised $54 million in venture capital following a recent Series B funding round led by Bessemer Ventures August Capital Amity Ventures Ridge Ventures as well as the founders of UiPath and Thumbtack. We‚Äôre looking for MaintainXs first Design Leader to help us build our design foundations grow our team and establish our brand and product identity. This is a role for a creative strategic and autonomous individual that excels in a fast-paced environment. You will immediately lead two organizations: Brand Design and Product Design. On Brand Design you will be charged with establishing our brand voice so that it can speak to our SMBs and Enterprises across a number of industries. On Product Design you will partner with our product leaders to define the next evolution of our product and inspire your team in executing on it. ¬† You‚Äôll have an opinion about the right direction to go the flexibility to change course when needed and the communication skills to provide clarity to the rest of the team. ¬†  Our current Design Team is based in Buenos Aires Argentina. We work on all Product Visual and Motion initiatives across the company and count with 8 great designers (so far). We work on a daily basis with our folks from Canada and the US. ¬† This is a full-time remote position for people based in  - Buenos Aires Argentina or  - Toronto CA or   - Montreal CA What you‚Äôll do:   Define and maintain the design and quality bar for our product and our brand. Partner with Product and Engineering to define the product strategy and roadmap that will enable the company to scale R&D while building out the next evolution of our product. Lead the definition of our brand identity in partnership with Marketing to help drive our GTM strategy in attracting SMBs and Enterprises within Manufacturing and future industry verticals.  Help cultivate the design culture within the team and along the company by including user-centric design thinking across all our initiatives and maintaining a collaborative design process.  Improve operational excellence for the team by determining the right processes and tools that will enable designers to work efficiently creatively and collaboratively.  Manage and scale the Design Organization based on company needs across both Brand and Product.  Establish the foundations for customer research by incorporating people resources and processes that help us determine the best approaches and methods to follow in order to capture the insights we need.  About you:  You have a minimum of 5+ years of experience as a design lead/manager and you‚Äôre passionate about developing designers‚Äô skills and careers. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and is able to communicate your ideas to the team and company leads. You lean towards fast execution and is able to balance providing value to users quickly while building scalable solutions. You have a proven track record of designing successful products that users love. You have a background as a Visual UX/UI and Product designer. You are a Figma Master and have a deep and updated knowledge on design tools and engineering best practices. You have experience with data-driven decision-making but also have an ability to manage ambiguity with solid customer and business intuition. You have empathy for customer needs but can also consider technical constraints and business goals. You‚Äôre passionate about inclusive design and accessibility.  What‚Äôs in it for you:  Competitive salary and meaningful equity opportunities. You‚Äôll lead the design team on a product that‚Äôs used by +150k users today and millions tomorrow. You‚Äôll have autonomy and ownership over the design direction of the company.  You‚Äôll get to work with amazing friendly smart colleagues all incredibly passionate about solving real world problems in a flexible working environment. Take what you need PTO. A Work Culture where:  You‚Äôll work alongside folks across the globe that reflect the MaintainX values Smart Humble Optimist We believe in meritocracy where ideas and effort are publicly celebrated   Our mission is to make the life of blue-collar workers easier worldwide by creating software that meets their needs and realities. Our product is truly life-changing for 80% of the workforce that doesn‚Äôt work behind a desk and needs enterprise-grade software at their fingertips. MaintainX is committed to creating a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race colour religion gender gender identity or expression sexual orientation national origin genetics disability age or veteran status.

title: Accounting Professionals
description:
Ready to learn more about us?
We were founded in 2010 with a dynamic and agile start-up spirit. The trust of around 30 million customers and 250000 sellers has made us the first decacorn in Turkey. Our success is backed by renowned investors such as Alibaba General Atlantic Softbank Princeville Capital and several sovereign wealth funds. In 2022 we opened our first dedicated international office in Berlin and expanded to Amsterdam Luxembourg and London. And thats just the beginning!
Tech at the root
We believe that technology is the driver and e-commerce is the outcome. Thanks to the dedication of our team we have become one of the top 5 e-commerce companies in EMEA and one of the fastest growing worldwide. We currently deliver over 1.5 million parcels daily to 27 countries.
Growth is in our DNA
As a young and dynamic company we are constantly growing and expanding. With Trendyol Tech one of the leading R&D centres Trendyol Express the fastest growing delivery network Dolap the largest platform for second-hand goods and Trendyol Go our instant food and grocery delivery service we are gearing up to become the worlds leading e-commerce platform.
Focused on positive impact
Our vision goes beyond business success. We strive to make a sustainable and positive impact on our customers business partners and society. By digitizing merchants and SMEs helping businesses grow and promoting womens economic empowerment we are dedicated to creating a better future.
ABOUT THE TEAM
The Finance Team is Trendyols control center. The team acts as a bridge between commercial teams and customers in order to provide financial sustainability and efficiency for the company.
We are all working with the same purpose: To create a positive impact in our ecosystem by enabling commerce through technology. YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES 
Process accounting transactions accurately timely in accordance with Turkish GAAP (mainly opex invoices)
International invoice recording within the framework of double taxation legislation
Calculation of monthly exchange difference reporting and following invoices
Control of monthly payroll report and preparing its records
Keeping track of fixed asset invoices and calculation
Taking part in the follow-up of private costs and ongoing investments
To carry out the preparation processes of the all declarations
Execute e-invoice and e-ledger processes will be actively involved for monthly closing processes with tight deadline. QUALITIES WERE LOOKING FOR 
Bachelors degree in Business Administration Economics Accounting Engineering Finance or relevant fields
5-10 years of previous accounting experience
Experience in SAP FI Module
Willingness to improve processes which are handled manually
Continuously desire for self improvement
Good command of English both in speaking and writing
High attention to detail strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
Strong excel skills
Ability to work well in a variety of different cross-functional teams and build strong working relationships across the organization
Preferably have a CPA certificate. Additional Information 
JOIN US AND
* Take responsibility from day one and develop your skills with a talented and diverse international team.
* Experience open communication flexibility and a start-up spirit in our unique culture.
* Tackle big challenges in e-commerce with Agile practices and encourage growth by learning from mistakes.
* Join creative and focused teams that prioritize collaboration and problem-solving.
* Access our extensive training platform for continuous learning and personal growth.
* Benefit from the support of a global team of experts with mentoring and professional development opportunities.
* Focus on talent and potential not just job titles.
* Connect with teammates regardless of physical distance through events meetings and social activities.
* Enjoy competitive benefits such as Trendyol shopping budget central and international office locations and top-of-the-line technical equipment.
Were looking forward to receiving your application!
We embrace a hybrid working model that seamlessly blends the best of both worlds‚Äîremote productivity and the collaborative energy of our vibrant offices. Every month we gather at our offices once to work side by side fostering in person communication and embracing the camaraderie that fuels our team spirit. These sessions are crucial for teamwork in solving complex issues socializing learning from each other and experiencing our culture. 
Each division has a pre-set optional office day each week. Based on our preferences we come together at our offices at our discretion as an opportunity to feel more team spirit immerse in our culture and familiarize ourselves with our way of workings.
We offer the opportunity for a two-month full remote work program allowing you to work from abroad during the summer period (July to August). 
This working model applies to our hybrid job postings; on-site roles require being based in an office work environment.
Discover more about our #LifeatTrendyol and our culture on our WebsiteLinkedInandYouTubechannels.
At Trendyol we believe in the power of an inclusive workplace. We value diversity and believe that every team member contributes to our vibrant culture. Our platform is for everyone and so is our workplace. We encourage the representation and amplification of diverse voices in our business as it allows us all to thrive contribute and shape the future together.

title: Researcher
description:
You like to solve problems. You are curious inquisitive and innovative. You believe that successful products emerge from well-researched problems and are built by successful teams with attention to detail effective communication and collaboration. You enjoy analyzing data and ideas to help customers solve problems. For you research is about collaborating with an interdisciplinary team working closely with customers designing studies collecting data and constantly evaluating how to make our work better. You are looking for an opportunity where you can combine your desire to solve problems work with people and continue to develop your research and evaluation skills.
The Researcher is a critical position on the LearnPlatform by Instructure Research team to ensure the consistent delivery of high-quality research and evaluation in alignment with our roadmap strategy company goals and mission. The position offers an incredible growth opportunity for a motivated analytical and organized individual who wants to have an immediate impact on the education technology space. The Researcher position offers a path to expand your skills and experience while working with a team that is committed to having a positive impact on education. What you will do: 
Be a champion for our research and evaluation work both internally and externally
Support data quality assurance efforts
Develop program logic models and theories of change for provider customers
Execute survey interview and focus group protocols with K-12 audiences
Analyze education data infer results and generate reports for non-technical and technical audiences
Perform literature reviews and support grant writing efforts
Communicate with providers and K-12 administrators about educational research and evaluation designs study status and results using non-technical language
Own and manage deliverables that progress ESSA-aligned evaluations research projects and company goals
Organize document and communicate planned work with the Associate Director of Research Senior Researchers and your team
Work with Researchers Product Managers Designers Marketers and Engineers to execute planned work in alignment with our roadmap What you will need to know/have: 
At least 2-4 years of professional experience working in K-12 education research or program evaluation
Masters or Doctorate degree in Evaluation Educational Psychology Psychology Learning Sciences Social Sciences or other related field
Willingness and ability to work in a fast-paced results-driven environment
Strong time management project management and organizational skills
Comfort with various statistical software for quantitative analysis (e.g. Stata R SPSS)
Experience translating technical findings for non-technical audiences
Experience with Asana JIRA Trello and/or other project management tools
Strong attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proven ability to work in a highly collaborative environment with interdisciplinary teams
Self-starter with a bias towards responsible action
Demonstrated problem-solving aptitude
Demonstrated ability to regularly meet and exceed expectations particularly as it relates to communication and project deadlines The most competitive candidates will also have: 
Experience with advanced quantitative analysis methods including multilevel models structural equation models and propensity score matching.
Experience working for a software development organization
Experience or familiarity with What Works Clearinghouse version 5.0 guidelines and/or ESSA evidence tiers.
Aptitude and desire to translate research into practice
Ability to clean merge and structure data
Ability to analyze data infer results and generate reports
Ability to visualize data for non-technical audiences
Experience conducting surveys and/or interviews
Excellent written and verbal communication skills Some projects may include: 
Find and synthesize research into a coherent foundational literature review for a product
Use statistical software to analyze education data for a customer project or product development efforts.
Collaborate with a customer to define a program logic model and execute a Correlative or QED study to evaluate program impacts on student learning outcomes.
Document research or evaluation findings with effective written and visual reports.
Brainstorm within and across teams to identify and execute on research-based solutions for our customers. Get in on all the awesome at Instructure: 
Competitive salary and 401k
Medical dental disability and life insurance benefits
HSA program vision voluntary life and AD&D
Tuition reimbursement
Paid time off 10 paid holidays and flexible work schedules
Lifestyle spending account 
Base salary depends on experience. Equity package will be granted on top of base salary.  Additional Information 
We‚Äôve always believed in hiring the most awesome people and treating them right. We know that the more diverse we are the more diverse our ideas will be and when we openly welcome those ideas our environment is better and our business is stronger.
At Instructure we participate in E-Verify and yes in case you didnt catch it from the above we are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
All Instructure employees are required to successfully pass a background check upon being hired.

title: Technical Program Manager - Japan
description:
See yourself at Twilio Join the team as our next Technical Program Manager Partners. Who we are & why we‚Äôre hiring Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help 
companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences. Although were headquartered in San Francisco we have presence throughout South America Europe Asia and Australia. Were on a journey to becoming a global company that actively opposes racism and all forms of oppression and bias. At Twilio we support diversity equity & inclusion wherever we do business. About the job This position is needed to help Twilio‚Äôs largest and highest impact customers successfully launch production solutions using Twilio‚Äôs products and APIs. You will create and drive software launch plans timelines and solution designs that help customers efficiently and successfully drive their projects to production. You anticipate bottlenecks explore contingencies and provide effective escalation management. Even better you love to analyze data and have built tools to monitor and track launch metrics on a daily weekly and quarterly basis. Ultimately you will create a great experience for Twilio customers and help Twilio services scale to make even more customers wildly successful! Responsibilities In this role you‚Äôll:  Enable the Twilio ISV/Partner team to bring deep implementation experience to the top customers in your market creating marquee implementations and customer relationships that fuel Twilio‚Äôs growth for years to come. Lead implementations for our top customers on migrations implementations and service engagements.¬†¬† Work with high impact customers and partners solving technical challenges while fostering confidence in our platform. Create project plans that help customers efficiently and successfully drive their projects to production and oversee their implementation with a combination of on-site and remote meetings. Serve as an important advocate for customer needs relaying information back to sales product support and others. Travel when needed to run discovery and project planning sessions with customers.  Qualifications¬† Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having ‚Äúdesired‚Äù qualifications make for a strong candidate we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasnt followed a traditional path dont let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table! Required:  7+ years experience in Project Management able to run a full customer engagement from kickoff to acceptance.¬†¬† Experience working with APIs and cloud-based technologies familiar with software development methodologies. Experience with architecting for scale resilience and security and have successfully launched and managed multiple complex software development projects in your career.¬† Proficiency in English and Japanese  Desired:  Familiar with at least one major contact center solution.  Location¬† This role will be remote and based in Tokyo Japan. Approximately 50% travel is anticipated.¬† ¬† What We Offer There are many benefits to working at Twilio including in addition to competitive pay things like generous time-off ample parental and wellness leave healthcare a retirement savings program and much more. Offerings vary by location. Twilio thinks big. Do you? We like to solve problems take initiative pitch in when needed and are always up for trying new things. Thats why we seek out colleagues who embody our values ‚Äî something we call
 Twilio Magic. Additionally we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts. So if youre ready to unleash your full potential do your best work and be the best version of yourself apply now! If this role isnt what youre looking for 
please consider other open positions. ¬† 
 
 
 
 
 
Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.¬†Twilio is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity¬†and Affirmative Action¬†employer. title: Associate Project Manager for Key Accounts
description:
About Ergeon We are disrupting the trillion-dollar construction industry with technology making it possible for almost any profession to operate remotely. Our company is the only startup combining the strengths of technology and remote work to solve the challenges of residential construction.¬† Unlike most other products and services hiring a contractor for a home improvement project is very far from a 1-click experience today. Ergeon aims to empower skilled local contractors with human and technology-powered services to make home improvement easy. We take a full-stack approach to create a seamless experience for homeowners and leverage technology to scale the front & back offices of contractors. With the belief that everyone has a right to professional growth and respect regardless of their location we proudly have staff (aka Ergeoneers) in over 40 of countries with a great score and recommendation rating on Glassdoor. Come join us to make construction friendly and accessible! ¬† Ergeon: er - g- eon Erg = unit of work or energy Eon = billion years ¬† Ergeon is founded by CS Ph.D. serial entrepreneurs Jiayue (Jenny) He and Odysseas Tstatalos. They picked this name to symbolize their joint passion for using tech to revolutionize work.¬†  ¬† Overview of the Role We are seeking a motivated and experienced Associate Project Manager to manage and grow our key accounts. As an Associate Project Manager you will play a critical role in ensuring customer satisfaction by creating and executing account plans building strong customer relationships and managing the project from start to finish. We are looking for a candidate who can act as a bridge between Sales and Delivery during the sales stage to ensure a smooth handoff and communication of project requirements.  ¬† Responsibilities  Manage and grow key accounts by developing and executing account plans aligned with customer goals and objectives. Confirm installer capacity to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget. Provide remote support to ensure projects are completed to customer satisfaction. Ensure Ergeon is compliant with all necessary regulations to build the project. Handle VIP customers by providing a tailored experience. Handle processes and build exceptions to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget. Handle custom payment processes as needed to ensure timely invoice payment.   ¬† Desired Skills and Experience Must have  2 years of experience in key account management project management or related field. Fluency in both English and Spanish. Proven track record of success in managing key accounts and driving revenue growth. Excellent written and verbal communication interpersonal and relationship-building skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills to complete and appropriately document tasks in multi-step processes. Tech savvy and quick to interface with multiple programs/websites/spreadsheets at once. Experience handling escalated customers. Experience handling negotiations with both customers and installers/contractors.  Nice to have  B2B Negotiation experience. Prior knowledge in home services Prior experience in construction project management   ¬† Technical Requirements Good Laptop setup with Chrome browser  Minimum of 8GB RAM  Minimum processor:   For Intel variants of CPUs:  Core i3 8000 Series (8th Gen) or higher Pentium N5000 series (Quad-core variant) or higher Celeron J5000 series or higher (quad-core variant)  
  For AMD variants of CPUs:  Ryzen 3 3rd generation or higher  
  
  ¬† Stable high-speed internet connection  At least 5mbps upload and 20 Mbps download  ¬† Headset   With a noise cancelling microphone  ¬† Power backup  250-300W UPS  ¬† Data availability  Ability to access up to 1.5GB of data per day during storm outages   ¬† Compensation Monthly salary between $1950-2150 USD  depending on experience and location.  Your final compensation will depend on your placement on our Career Ladder and will be calculated hourly. Youll be paid weekly through Upwork (www.upwork.com) the platform we choose to hire and pay our Ergeoneers all over the world.   ¬† Additional important information Location  This is a 100% remote position for people located in: Anguilla Antigua and Barbuda Aruba Bahamas Barbados Belize Bolivia Brazil Chile Colombia Costa Rica Dominica Dominican Republic Ecuador El Salvador French Guiana Grenada Guatemala Guyana Haiti Honduras Mexico Nicaragua Panama Paraguay Peru Saint Kitts and Nevis Saint Lucia Saint Vincent and The Grenadines Suriname Trinidad and Tobago Turks and Caicos Uruguay Venezuela.
  
Availability  This position is full-time with expectations of at least 40 hours per week.  Availability Monday through Sunday¬† between 7:00am -¬† 6:00 pm PST/CST/EST. 
 The expectation is to cover at least 40 scheduled hours that fall on any of the days mentioned above.  Bootcamp  Training period of 4 weeks including: 1-1 sessions constant mentoring teamwork practical use and understanding of our technical tools and live exercises to develop abilities. You are going to be able to do a full immersion in the day-to-day job enjoy our amazing company culture make great friends and learn a lot! We are completely convinced that this period gives you the opportunity to decide if the job and the company are your perfect match and it also helps us to know you better.   ¬† Ergeon‚Äôs benefits and perks for full staff members  Competitive compensation:¬†We invest in people! We are constantly doing worldwide market research in order to offer globally competitive salaries. And we are well funded by VCs. ¬†¬†All-Remote since the beginning:¬†We have a diverse team spread across 40+ countries. We stay connected through the best remote work practices such as flexible work hours team events remote happy hours and by sharing¬†our love of food! ¬†¬†¬†¬†Tech Wellness & Learning fund: You can have a $400USD bonus per year for software and hardware tools workplace improvements fitness-related spending (includes things like yoga classes Fitbit tracker new running shoes gym membership. . .) and books courses training or even attending conferences. 
¬† Stock options:¬†All staff is eligible after 6 months of¬†full-time¬†work. ¬†¬†Birthday Paid day off:¬†You can take the exact day or Friday before if it is on a weekend! ¬†¬†Flexible Paid time off:¬†You can take 12 days after working 6 months PLUS 2 extra days per year for a maximum of 20 days. ¬†¬†Free Headset Benefit:¬†You can get a noise-canceling headset since your first day working¬†full-time. 
¬† Equipment:¬†Laptop replacement after 1 year of¬†full-time¬†work. And every 3 years after that. 
¬†¬† Co-Working Fund:¬†Meet in groups of 3+ Ergeon friends and get reimbursed up to USD $20 for coffee co-working etc (once per quarter). 
¬† Language Classes:¬†here at Ergeon you will have the opportunity to learn or improve a language!  ¬† We believe everyone has a right to professional growth and respect no matter their location. Ergeon‚Äôs workforce is given meaningful opportunities and is supported by a kind and diverse community. Our global staff (Ergeoneers) have access to career growth amazing work culture and great benefits. Come join us to transform the construction industry!

We‚Äôre growing fast constantly innovating and couldn‚Äôt be prouder to help our customers move forward with confidence in a sophisticated and changing world. Because we fundamentally believe every colleague brings outstanding value to our whole. This team is customer facing and is crucial to our success.¬†¬† Insight on Your Impact¬†

¬†   Anaplan Model Building Level 3.¬†¬†

  4-year degree in a related field or equivalent experience¬†¬† 
  Advanced level Microsoft Excel experience required.¬† 
  Excellent client-facing skills and a successful track record of engagement management¬†¬† 
  Understanding of data integration (inbound and outbound) is a plus¬†¬† 
  At least 3 years of demonstratable technical troubleshooting experience¬† 
  Persistent nature and strong issue follow-through habits¬†¬† 
  Ability to thrive in a loosely structured dynamic and quick moving environment.¬†¬† 
  Superb communication & customer service skills and attitude¬†¬† 
  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills¬†¬†

  ¬† Great to have
¬†   3 years of experience with multi-dimensional financial modeling and business analytics systems such as Anaplan or similar ‚Äì I.e IBM Cognos Hyperion Business Objects TM1 SAP BPC etc. or spreadsheets¬†¬† 
  Salesforce¬†¬† 
  Splunk¬†¬† 
  JIRA¬†¬† 
  Confluence¬†¬† 
    Monitoring and logfile experience¬†¬† 
  Informatica¬†¬† 
  Performance testing¬†¬† 
    
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  
Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity inclusion and belonging. We believe in maintaining a hiring and working experience in which all people are respected and valued regardless of gender identity or expression sexual orientation religion ethnicity age neurodiversity disability status citizenship or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are and we want you to bring your true self to work every day! We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process perform essential job functions and receive equitable benefits and all privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Fraud Recruitment Disclaimer: It has come to our attention that fraudulent and fictitious job opportunities are being circulated on the Internet. Prospective candidates are being contacted by certain individuals mainly through telephone calls emails and correspondences claiming they are representatives of Anaplan. The main purpose of these correspondences and announcement is to obtain privileged information from individuals.¬† Anaplan¬†does not:  Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or¬†in person.¬† Send job offers via email. All offers are¬†first¬†extended verbally¬†by¬†a member of our internal recruitment team¬†whenever possible¬†and then followed up via written communication.  All emails from Anaplan would come from an @anaplan.com¬†email address. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email letter or telephone communication purportedly from for or on behalf of Anaplan please send an email¬†to¬†humanresources@anaplan.com¬†before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.¬†

title: Outbound Coordinator, Predict (US, Remote)
description:
WHO WE ARE
Each year 2 billion people across the world are limited by physical pain. By helping people live without pain they are free to do the things they love most with the people they love‚Äîand never miss a moment. This is what we do. We create and design new technologies to solve one of the biggest problems in healthcare: taking care of our Physical Health. Sword Health is the world‚Äôs fastest growing digital musculoskeletal (MSK) care provider on a bold mission to free two billion people from acute chronic and post-surgical physical pain. Our customers include some of the most progressive Fortune 100 and 500 companies as well as over +1400 other established businesses across the world.
The Sword program allows members to complete a personalized physical therapy program from the comfort of home with continued support and supervision from one of our talented Sword specialists. Sword‚Äôs personalized care is more effective than traditional standards of care and has proven to deliver best-in-class clinical results. Since breaking into the market less than three years ago Sword has worked with insurers health systems and employers in the U.S. Canada Europe and Australia to make high quality musculoskeletal care accessible to everyone.
This is an opportunity to join Sword during a time of hyper growth and expansion. After our recent $2bn valuation we‚Äôre excited to continue accelerating our impact by scaling with high caliber people with passion commitment and energy to create and deliver technologies services and products that drive human progress forward.
We welcome you to join our mission to make a difference on a grand scale and play a pivotal role with a global team at Sword‚Äì working alongside great people pioneering novel products and cutting edge technologies.
Job Summary:
We are seeking a driven Concierge Coordinator to educate members on the benefits of the Sword program and helping members to engage in our program if they wish.
What you‚Äôll do on a daily basis:
Place 100+ outbound calls to members and respond to inbound members inquiries.
Communicate effectively and enthusiastically to encourage and motivate potential members to Sword‚Äôs digital physical therapy services.
Support interested members in registering for the Sword service by collecting pertinent history.
Provide concierge-level service with every member we connect with and establish a successful rapport to instill trust in our team.
Proactively communicate the benefits and the value of our service with every member you contact.
Collect and maintain accurate notes in our data system.
Follow up in a timely way with members and other team members.
Meet personal/ team qualitative and quantitative targets.
What We Are Looking For:
Bachelors Degree preferred
2 years of inside sales experience preferred
Experience in cold calling call center is preferred
Ability to navigate across technology platforms
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Why You Should Apply:
Be a part of a groundbreaking company where technology meets empathetic patient care.
Career development opportunities in a fast-growing sector of the healthcare industry.
A role with direct impact: your work meaningfully contributes to the health and well-being of our members.
An attractive base salary with the potential for significant earnings through our incentive program. Additional Information

Comprehensive health dental and vision insurance
Equity Shares
401(k)

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
parcelLab the leading Operations Experience Management platform is growing internationally and fast! Were looking for the best talent from across the world to help us bring people and brands closer together.
We are looking for a candidate with experience in setting up and operating reliable secure and scalable infrastructure platforms. You will be join our Engineering team as full-time Senior Site Reliability Engineer. In this role you will do foundational work for on our systems that power pre-checkout delivery and returns experiences for more than 550 brands worldwide.
As a digital-first company we offer greater flexibility in working location. Therefore you can work from one of our offices inLondon or Munichorremotely within the EU. What you can expect: 
Collaborate with engineering leadership engineering teams and specialists to deliver our infrastructure architecture & improvements which serves as foundation of our distributed high-throughput SaaS platform
As member of the infrastructure team you take the ownership of the could-platform capabilities maintain a high bar for quality in a fast-paced iterative environment and to ensure alignment with business objectives
You expose standardized tooling for Gitops CI/CD and containerized production platforms to other teams who will utilize those capabilities under your guidance
A large share of our infrastructure resources is already defined as IaC (via Terraform & k8s) we plan to continuously extend this code base to cover all of our critical production infrastructure. You will take a major role in defining our infrastructure roadmap going forward.
Take a key role in the core technical strategy of the company: you are significantly responsible for our overall success and your feedback and expertise are taken into consideration in the roadmap planning. You will be essential in defining how we apply cloud-native architecture and DevOps principles at parcelLab
A career track where you do not need to have had previous people management experience in order to succeed grow and be acknowledged What you need to succeed:  
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science Software Engineering or a related field
Proficiency in managing complex infastructures using IaC on cloud platforms like AWS GCP or Azure. Hands-on experience with Terraform & AWS is a plus
Familiarity with managing containers on k8s or AWS ECS previous experience with CI/CD solutions based on for instance ArgoCD and Github actions
You are technically fluent at the OS (Linux) & networking level are familiar with data privacy & security best practices such as OS/image and network hardening. You are able to apply those skills to help us maintain our SOC & HIPAA certifications
Experience with the management of infrastructure compents which are typical in SaaS deployments such as for instance databases (e.g. Postgres MongoDB Redshift) messages queues (e.g. SQS Kafka) API gatways load balancers is a plus
Comfortable helping teams to define monitoring and alerting rules. In addition you have created and maintained alerting and monitoring systems like Prometheus and central logging infrastructure like the ELK stack Datadog or similar
Demonstrated capacity to clearly and concisely communicate about complex technical architectural and/or organizational problems and propose thorough iterative solutions
Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong commitment to a product-focused mindset
Excellent problem-solving critical thinking and communication skills
Fluent in English; proficiency in German is a plus Additional Information 
Perks & Benefits:
üß† Plenty of room for your own ideas...space to try fail and learn!
üõ≥ Comprehensive 30-60-90 day onboarding plan in place from the very first day to help you integrate seamlessly with the rest of the company and understand new responsibilities
üèù As a digital-first company you choose whether to work entirely from home in one of our offices or a mix that suits you. Not close to one of our offices No problem! Find yourself a co-working space instead and we‚Äôll pay
ü™¥ Make use of our home office set-up budget to get kitted out (a spacious desk comfy chair some houseplants or great tech accessories!) and all this alongside the latest MacBook or PC
üöÄ Career development opportunities including our Leadership Development Program and our Future Leaders Program as well as online language courses available budgets for further training and access to LinkedIn Learning
üßòüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Stay grounded with our free meditation mindfulness and coaching sessions via our mental wellbeing platformnilo.health
üéâ Regular company retreats parcelLab events (in-person and online) local and regional meet-ups as well as team off-sites
üåè Be part of a motivated diverse and international team made up of over 34 different nationalities; and with a five-star rating for company culture and employee experience on Glassdoor you‚Äôll love working here!
About parcelLab:
We bring people and brands closer together by closing the experience gap post-sales and beyond transforming operational complexity into opportunities to outperform for 550+ brands worldwide including IKEA Bose Puma Lidl Farfetch and Nespresso.
With offices in Munich London and Boston we have been highlighted by the Financial Times as one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in 2021.

title: Sr. Manager, Product Design
description:
Matterport Inc. (Nasdaq: MTTR) is leading the digital transformation of the built world. Millions of buildings in more than 177 countries have been transformed into immersive Matterport digital twins to improve every part of the building lifecycle from planning construction and operations to documentation appraisal and marketing. Inspirational and inclusive leadership style
Excellent communication skills
Generous responsible and proactive mindset
Relentless attention to detail
Exceptional project management skills

Portfolio of executed work in the product space

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $126800 to $264200 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role level and location. title: Senior Product Manager (remote)
description:
At Yardzen we believe people are at their best when they‚Äôre outside.
We have a simple promise:help people envision the outdoor spaces of their dreams all online and then match them with the right local contractors to bring their design to life. Since our launch in 2018 we‚Äôve helped thousands of homeowners achieve their dream yards make environmentally responsible decisions boost their property values and get more out of their outdoor spaces.
We are disrupting the $200 billion outdoor renovation industry. By leveraging technology and creating an innovative online process we offer a more straightforward transparent and delightful design and build experience for the modern homeowner. We‚Äôve been recognized as a Forbes Best Startup Employer Fast Company Most Innovative Company named to Inc. Magazine‚Äôs Best Places to Work and written about by Architectural Digest The New York Times Sunset Magazine House Beautiful The Wall Street Journal and Forbes. And we‚Äôre just getting started.
We‚Äôre looking for an experienced 
Senior Product Manager to take Yardzen‚Äôs product experience to the next level. You‚Äôll launch and maintain platform experiences that increase customer delight and engagement cultivate innovation and drive value across the customer journey. The ideal candidate knows how to break down complex features and anticipates the needs for many different types of users (customers landscape designers internal team members contractors etc.).This is a critical cross-functional role that will have a meaningful impact on the Product team. You will work closely with Product Engineering Marketing Data and Operations and your work will have significant exposure to senior leadership. Key Responsibilities: 
Be a contributor to Yardzen‚Äôs Product and engineering culture by owning and managing the different phases of the product life cycle process
Manage and prioritize multiple product features and projects simultaneously that are in different stages and with different sets of stakeholders
Comfortable managing your day-to-day tasks independently
Collaborate with the Engineering team from start to finish on complex product features by gathering and preparing requirements scoping and defining ‚ÄúMVP‚Äù selecting a technical approach writing JIRA tickets testing in Staging and Production environments
Coordinate with the Senior Product Designer on design requirements and ensure that product designs are reviewed approved and engineering-ready
In partnership with the Engineering Manager manage the day-to-day activities of the Engineering team members
Assist/host agile product development ceremonies like daily standup planning retros breakouts etc.
Drive cross-functional collaboration and communication with key stakeholders and team members including Marketing Engineering Data and Operations to ensure successful product and feature releases.
Partner closely with Product and Engineering to ensure a cohesive customer journey cross-platforms
Partner closely with Marketing to ensure consistent product positioning and branding cross-platforms
Be the voice and advocate for Yardzen‚Äôs customers: Conduct market research gather customer insights and analyze competitive landscapes to identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
Monitor product performance metrics conduct data analysis and gather feedback to make data-driven decisions and optimize product performance.
Manage and own the yardzen.com content management system (CMS) and publishing process.
Deep understanding and knowledge of Marketing needs for websites and webpages
Prioritize and execute web A/B tests to measure the impact of changes and further optimize performance and increase conversion rates About you: 
Proven track record of at least 5 years in product management roles including experience in D2C and/or marketplace platforms.
Experience product managing AI or data features are a plus.
Strong leadership and team management skills with the ability to inspire and mentor cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication presentation and interpersonal skills.
Strategic thinker with a data-driven and customer-centric approach to decision-making.
Proficiency in product management tools agile methodologies and project management techniques.
Experience with Jira Figma Miro Wordpress Maze usertesting.com userfeeling.com HotJar Typeform Squarespace Slack Zapier Split.io are a plus In addition: 
You believe in the benefits of outdoor living and appreciate beautiful spaces
You have startup experience and thrive under pressure and with ambiguity
You embrace change and lead with a growth mindset Benefits & Perks: 
Equity in Yardzen
Company-sponsored medical dental and vision insurancefor the employee
Unlimited PTO + NTO per quarter (Nature Time Off)
12 weeks paid parental leave 
Health & wellness stipend
Cell phone and internet stipend
Home office stipend Additional Information 
At Yardzen we‚Äôre committed to creating a space where our employees can bring their full selves to work and have equal opportunities to succeed. We are looking for people that will add to our culture not just fit in. So regardless of race gender identity or expression sexual orientation religion origin ability age or veteran status if joining this mission speaks to you we encourage you to apply!
Since April 2020 were a remote-first organization. We believe work is a thing you do not a place you go and we can stay connected as an organization from anywhere. We believe that clearly defined goals combined with awesome people authentic empowerment and autonomy create the best results. 
If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the application or the recruiting process please contact us at recruiting@yardzen.com.
Yardzen is registered as an employer in many but not all states. If you are not located in a state where Yardzen is registered you will not be eligible for employment.

title: Corporate Counsel, EMEA
description:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money where value can finally travel like other digital data ‚Äî globally nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure ‚Äì including USDC a blockchain-based dollar ‚Äì helps businesses institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology. What you‚Äôll be part of: Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization were expanding into some of the worlds strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder Mindfulness Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder. What you‚Äôll be responsible for:¬† Under the direction of the Assistant General Counsel Products & Regulatory you will play an immediate and direct role in providing legal support for scaling Circle‚Äôs product suite ongoing licensing efforts enterprise risk and compliance functions and the policy and strategy function advising the company on a wide-range of regulatory compliance governance enterprise risk and policy matters contributing to and overseeing a variety of design implementation and operation objectives aligning and coordinating priorities and activities with cross-functional stakeholders. We are looking for someone who is highly proactive accountable team-oriented capable of managing multiple competing priorities and excited to join a lean team that executes on a variety of novel and complex legal issues. What youll work on:  Providing support to Circle‚Äôs global legal operations risk management efforts and strategic business objectives and priorities. Advising Circle stakeholders on among other things comprehensive approaches to a variety of product development initiatives regulatory compliance and enterprise risk management matters and guidance. Collaborating closely with product policy business compliance and enterprise risk team members to define scope engage stakeholders prioritize and drive execution of key initiatives. Owning and managing multiple projects legally compliant process improvements and workstreams critical to large scale complex initiatives. Advising on product and regulatory assessments and leading adoption of jurisdictionally compliant legal principles ensuring compliance by design into business operations. Providing thought leadership consistent with Circle‚Äôs related business objectives strategies policies standards and procedures. Proactively identifying a variety of compliance risk areas and strategies to mitigate them.  In addition to core work on Products & Regulatory issues you will. . . ¬†  Structure negotiate and draft complex fintech payments crypto and tech transactions addressing legal risk in business-centric ways with the goal of strengthening partnerships and advancing opportunities. Managing corporate governance matters including reviewing maintaining and updating various corporate governance documents policies procedures and local filings and¬† assisting in the preparation of agendas materials resolutions and minutes for local entity meetings of the Board.  You will aspire to our four core values:   Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers shareholders employees and families and local communities.  Mindful - you seek to be respectful an active listener and to pay attention to detail.¬†¬†  Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.¬†  High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.¬† You reject manipulation dishonesty and intolerance.  What you‚Äôll bring to Circle:¬†  7+ years of legal experience with a strong demonstrated knowledge of:  The ability to manage a variety of initiatives matters and transactions requiring an analysis and distillation of relevant laws regulations and industry standards ideally in a financial services environment and experience in performing supporting complex legal research and preparing legal memoranda intended for internal clients and senior leadership EMEA regional laws and issues relevant to Circle‚Äôs business and in relation to evolving product and technology requirements and standards in the fintech payments and/or cryptocurrency and blockchain ecosystems.¬† Broad product development and compliance experience in the crypto/payments/fintech industry and experience interfacing with applicable regulatory agencies holding jurisdiction over the same.¬†   Extensive experience drafting and negotiating complex fintech financial services and technology agreements in a regulated environment.  Experience working in the EMEA region preferred (in-house law department or top-tier law firm); connections to the EMEA region also preferred. Experience working with and presenting to diverse cross-functional teams and senior leadership. You are passionate about Circle‚Äôs mission and values financial technology and the disruptive potential of cryptocurrency and blockchains. You are comfortable working outside of your comfort zone in an evolving and growing environment that is prone to rapid changes extreme velocity and managing multiple projects simultaneously. You apply sound practical business judgment to your legal recommendations and are creative at solving problems while balancing important legal risks for the business. You can exercise good judgment in time-sensitive high-pressure situations work autonomously and independently with minimal guidance and are also comfortable working collaboratively as part of a team. You are obsessively organized energetic passionate about supporting your team/ a team player. You possess a J.D. (or foreign equivalent degree) and active membership in at least one U.S. State Bar. Three (3) years minimum prior experience at a top-tier law firm.¬† Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Fluency in oral and written English. Experience/familiarity with Slack Apple MacOS and GSuite.   We are an 
equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race religion color national origin gender sexual orientation age marital status veteran status or disability status. Additionally Circle participates in the¬†E-Verify Program¬†in certain locations as required by law. #LI-Remote

title: Backend Engineer II, Growth
description:
LTK‚Äôs mission is to empower the world‚Äôs premium lifestyle Creators to achieve maximum economic success. We have a huge opportunity ahead of us and we‚Äôre looking for team members who want to create innovate and disrupt an industry.¬† We empower our team members to drive innovation create value and continue to spearhead the creation of this industry ‚Äî a game changer when it comes to career growth. ¬† Title: Software Engineer Backend¬†
Location: US-Remote Job Purpose: Join the LTK Family! We are looking for talented developers who are passionate about tackling challenging features and interesting problems at scale. Youll be working with a team of highly motivated and fast-moving professionals focused on creating innovative features services and products. Key Responsibilities:  Design and develop scalable reliable and high-performance systems using Golang and related technologies. Collaborate with product and engineering teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications. Write clean efficient and maintainable code that adheres to best practices and coding standards. Write automated tests to ensure high code quality and reduce regression risks. Continuously improve the performance scalability and reliability of our systems. Drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects. Work and succeed in a fast-paced and agile development environment. Identify and drive improvements to our software and development processes. Work with distributed teams across different time zones.  Qualifications:  3+ years of software development experience. History of designing and building highly scalable distributed systems in a cloud environment. Experience writing services in Golang Python. Experience with AWS services such as ECS Lambda and RDS. Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes. Experience with CICD tools such as GitHub Actions or CircleCI. Familiarity with infrastructure as code such as CloudFormation or Terraform. Solid understanding of distributed systems databases and web protocols (REST HTTP etc.). Have built scalable internal and public-facing APIs (REST JSON HTTP). Comfortable shipping code multiple times per day. Ability to model and conceptualize complex systems. Excellent verbal and written communication skills to both technical and non-technical audiences.  Nice to have:  Experience with non-relational data stores such as DynamoDB or Cassandra. Knowledge of domain-driven design. Experience integrating systems for auth and identity management. Familiar with feature flags and A/B testing. Familiar with knowledge of observability tools such as DataDog.  #LI-JF1  What we offer  The opportunity to be part of the leading global company in creator commerce A remote-first productivity-first environment Competitive compensation and benefits package to meet the needs of you and your family 401(k) with LTK matching Wellness reimbursement Paid parental leave program Summer Fridays birthday PTO and paid volunteerism days In-person team events  Benefits package includes: Medical insurance PPO FSA HSA Wellness benefits Vision insurance Dental insurance Paid maternity leave Paid paternity leave Family Bonding Time Disability insurance Life insurance AD&D Short-Term disability Paid time off Pet insurance benefits and more #LI-Remote  About LTK Founded in 2011 LTK is the global technology platform purpose-built to empower lifestyle creators to monetize their content. The full-service platform connects brands creators and shoppers with a world-class shopping app and trusted tools and technology that make content instantly shoppable. Today premium lifestyle creators in 150+ countries drive more than $3.6 billion in annual retail sales through their LTK Shop profiles. More than 20 million consumers turn to LTK Shops in the LTK shopping platform each month to find inspiration and instantly shop the styles recommended by their favorite creators. And more than 6000 brands partner with LTK to gain access to its global creator network for content that converts against performance-driven cross-channel KPIs. LTK is headquartered in Dallas TX and currently operates on five continents.¬† Our mission To empower the world‚Äôs premium lifestyle Creators to achieve maximum economic success. Our values  Be a team player Make an impact Bring on the fun  Commitment to diversity LTK believes diversity equity and inclusion are fundamental obligations that strengthen our team. We employ a diverse multi-disciplinary team to build a meaningful company and culture.¬†  For US-Based Roles:¬† We are not offering new sponsorships opportunities at this time for persons requiring employment visas such as an H-1B;¬†¬†authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment. Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of LTK are considered the property of LTK and are not subject to payment of agency fees. LTK is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:

title: Senior product design
description:
Similarweb is the leading digital intelligence platform used by over 3500 global customers. Our wide range of solutions power the digital strategies of companies like Google eBay and Adidas. We help our customers succeed in today‚Äôs digital world by giving them access to data-driven insights competitive benchmarks strategic analysis and more.¬†¬† In 2021 we went public on the New York Stock Exchange and we haven‚Äôt stopped growing since!¬† ¬†¬† We are looking for a passionate and creative Senior Product Designer to join the most creative design team in the industry. Youll lead with full ownership the product design process and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including product managers and engineers to turn complex problems into innovative and intuitive designs that meet both user needs and business goals. The Product Designer will report to the Director of Product Design B2B ¬†  Your role as an Senior Product Designer at Similarweb means your daily responsibilities may include:  Lead a complex area of our product with full ownership over the product design process from research and ideation to prototyping testing and final execution and hand-off to engineering Mentor other designers within the same group while leading the vision of product design within the group Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction visuals and experience Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex design roadblocks Create wireframes storyboards user flows and process flows to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas Maintain and improve our design systems and guidelines to ensure consistency and quality across our platform. Use quantitative and qualitative data tools to research track and measure the design flows Advocate for the user ensuring that user needs and feedback are at the forefront of the design and product process. Communicate with stakeholders including executives on design decisions progress and outcomes.  ¬†  What does the ideal candidate look like: ¬†   5+ years of experience in product design with a proven track record of delivering successful digital SaaS products. A strong portfolio that demonstrates your design skills process and impact on business objectives. Excellent communication skills - Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders¬† Ability to participate in high level strategy and vision discussions. Ability to think about product strategy and vision (not just how it should look but what we should build)¬† Up-to-date with the latest UI trends UX patterns techniques and technologies Experience working in a fast-paced environment. Experience in data visualization and working on complexed SaaS platforms - big advantage¬† Experience in Agile - advantage Experience in management - advantage  ¬† *All Similarweb offices work in a hybrid model so you can enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the benefits of building face-to-face connections with fellow Similarwebbers.* Why you‚Äôll love being a Similarwebber: You‚Äôll actually love the product you work with: Our customers aren‚Äôt our only raving fans. When we asked our employees why they chose to come work at Similarweb 99% of them said ‚Äúthe product.‚Äù Imagine how exciting your job is when you get to work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world. You‚Äôll find a home for your big ideas:¬† We encourage an open dialogue and empower employees to bring their ideas to the table. You‚Äôll find the resources you need to take initiative and create meaningful change within the organization.¬† We offer competitive perks & benefits:¬†We take your well-being seriously and offer competitive compensation packages to all employees. We also put a strong emphasis on community with regular team outings and happy hours. You can grow your career in any direction you choose:¬†Interested in becoming a VP or want to transition into a different department? Whether it‚Äôs Career Week personalized coaching or our ongoing learning solutions you‚Äôll find all the tools and opportunities you need to develop your career right here. Diversity isn‚Äôt just a buzzword:¬†People want to work in a place where they can be themselves. We strive to create a workplace that is reflective of the communities we serve where everyone is empowered to bring their full authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race gender ethnicity culture sexual orientation age religion spirituality identity and experience. We believe our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global more diverse and more digital every day.
